728153f-a.text:
Vernon Boulevard, north from Broadway. The frame house in the center, which is at the N. W. corner of Broadway, appears on Beors's 1873 map of Long Island City.

P. L Sperr        March 9, 1931

726238f-a.text:
Broadway, at the N. E. corner of Vernon Boulevard, showing an old Dutch house, said to have been the Mayor Debevoise house.
George D. Chinn  April 26, 1940

726238f-b.text:
Broadway, at the N. E. corner of Vernon Boulevard, showing an old Dutch house, said to have been the Mayor Debevoise house.
George D. Chinn  April 26, 1940

726239f-c.text:
Broadway, at the N. E. corner of Vernon Boulevard. Mr. E. L. Armbruster states that this may be the Mayor Henry Debevoise House, but that controversy exists as to the authenticity of that. He also makes reference to T. Dusenbury's map No. 540,1882. C. W.
Strong was the owner in 1873.
View 1: Eugene L. Armbruster  May, 1923
Views 2,3: P. L. Sperr  March 9, 1931

726239f-a.text:
Broadway, at the N. E. corner of Vernon Boulevard. Mr. E. L. Armbruster states that this may be the Mayor Henry Debevoise House, but that controversy exists as to the authenticity of that. He also makes reference to T. Dusenbury's map No. 540,1882. C. W.

726239f-b.text:
Broadway, at the N. E. corner of Vernon Boulevard. Mr. E. L. Armbruster states that this may be the Mayor Henry Debevoise House, but that controversy exists as to the authenticity of that. He also makes reference to T. Dusenbury's map No. 540,1882. C. W.

726240f-c.text:
Broadway, at the N. E. corner of Vernon Boulevard, showing an old farmhouse, dating back to pre-Revolutionary days. Eugene L. Armbruster states that this may have been Mayor Henry Debevoise's house, but that some disagreement exists whether it actually was. It was owned by Niss Bragar in 1841, and by C. W. Strang in 1873.
P. Bartlott was the owner in 1896.
Views 1,2: May, 1923
Views 3,4: April, 1925
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection

728154f-a.text:
Vernon Boulevard, adjoining the N. E. corner of Broadway, showing two attached frame dwellings, the property of C. W.
Strang in 1973.

George D. Chinn               April 26, 1940
